insurer_name: Financial & Legal Insurance Company Limited (arranged by Lexelle Limited)
coverage_summary: Legal expenses insurance providing cover for legal fees and costs up to £50,000 for civil claims relating to a second property that is not let out. Includes contract disputes, property protection claims, and access to 24/7 free legal advice helpline.
key_inclusions: 24/7 Free Legal Advice Line for legal issues under England, Wales, Scotland & Northern Ireland jurisdiction
Contract disputes for buying/hiring goods or services relating to the 2nd property (over £100 in dispute, or over £1,000 for construction work)
Property protection claims for physical damage to 2nd property land, building or contents
Nuisance or trespass claims relating to 2nd property
Professional fees up to £50,000 per period of cover
Defendant's costs if liable by court order
Mediation and alternative dispute resolution (with prior consent)
key_exclusions: Properties that are let for residential or other purposes including holidays
Contracts regarding profession, business or employment (except letting 2nd property)
Insurance policy or financial product contracts
Claims on buildings/land other than the 2nd property
Boundary disputes that predate the policy or occur within first 180 days
Defending property damage claims caused by the insured
Losses under £100 (or £1,500 if caused by authorized person in property)
Claims without reasonable prospect of success (less than 51% chance)
Judicial review or Human Rights Act proceedings
Claims against Lexelle Limited, the Insurer or Broker

coverage_limits.maximum_amount_per_period: £50,000 total including Professional Fees and Defendant's Costs for one or more claims during a single Period of Cover
coverage_limits.hourly_rate_for_representatives: £100 + VAT (may be increased at insurer's discretion)
coverage_limits.disbursement_threshold: £500 - prior permission required for disbursements exceeding this amount (including VAT)

sub_limits.contract_disputes_minimum: £100 minimum amount in dispute (£1,000 for construction/building work on 2nd property)
sub_limits.property_protection_minimum: £100 minimum loss value (£1,500 if caused by person authorized to be in property)
sub_limits.nuisance_or_trespass_excess: £250 excess payable on Professional Fees for nuisance or trespass claims (payable when claim accepted)

special_conditions: This is a 'claims made' policy - only covers claims notified within the period of cover
Claim must have 'Reasonable Prospect of Success' (more than 51% chance)
Full claim details must be received within 180 days of the event
Insurer appoints the Authorized Representative - not the insured's choice (except at point of legal proceedings)
Insured must not prejudice the claim by any action or inaction
Must cooperate with insurer and authorized representative
Cannot instruct representative to cease acting without good reason
Insurer consent required before: issuing proceedings, instructing counsel/experts, making appeals, settling claims, incurring disbursements over £500
Property must not be let for residential or other purposes including holidays
Change of address must be requested in writing and meet policy terms
excess_deductible: £250 excess applies to nuisance or trespass claims under Section 3 (Property Protection), payable when claim is accepted. No excess mentioned for contract disputes.
geographical_coverage: England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland only. Legal proceedings must be pursued in courts of these jurisdictions.
age_restrictions: No age restrictions mentioned in this policy
pre_existing_conditions: Boundary disputes that predate the Period of insurance or occur within the first 180 days are excluded. Events must occur during the Period of Cover.
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling off period from purchase or receipt of documents (whichever is later) - full refund if no claims made/pending. After 14 days, can cancel but no premium refund. Insurer can cancel with 14 days written notice for valid reasons (fraud, non-payment, threatening behavior, non-compliance, inaccurate information). Proportionate refund given if insurer cancels (except for fraud/misrepresentation where premium is retained).

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible after the event. Full details must be received within 180 days of the event giving rise to the claim.
required_documents: Complete and truthful report of facts giving rise to claim
Documentary evidence in support of claim
Any additional information requested by insurer or authorized representative
process_steps: Provide complete report with supporting evidence
Insurer makes preliminary assessment of merits and reasonable prospect of success
If claim appears to fall under cover, insurer appoints Authorized Representative
If dispute about prospects, insurer instructs independent representative for advice
If accepted, representative must provide written assessment within 28 days
Representative must notify insured and insurer immediately of settlement proposals or changes in prospects
Representative must obtain insurer consent before major actions (issuing proceedings, instructing counsel, appeals, settlements, disbursements over £500)
If claim rejected or representative refuses to continue, insurer liability ends
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Documentary evidence of the contract or event, witness details, proof of loss value, written confirmation of contracts (verbal contracts excluded)
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Tel: 0114 249 3300, Claims Manager, Lexelle Ltd, P.O. Box 4428, Sheffield, S9 9DD, Email: assist@lexelle.com

eligibility_criteria.medical_restrictions: Not applicable to this legal expenses policy
eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Claims regarding profession, business or employment are excluded (except for letting out the 2nd property)
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be resident in England, Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland. Property must be located in these jurisdictions.
other_restrictions: Property must be a 2nd property (not the only or principle home)
Property must NOT be let for residential or other purposes including holidays
Covers static caravans and park homes
Insured must be the owner of the property

policy_definitions.2nd_property: The property identified in the schedule (including static caravans and park homes), that is not the insured's only or principle home. Must not be let for residential or other purposes including holidays.
policy_definitions.authorized_representative: A solicitor, counsel, claims handler or mediator or other appropriately qualified person appointed and approved by the insurer to represent the insured's interests
policy_definitions.civil_claim: A claim for damages or compensation falling within the civil jurisdiction of the courts of the country in which the claim is made
policy_definitions.condition: An obligation which the insured must perform. If not performed, insurer will not be liable to pay anything under the policy
policy_definitions.defendant's_costs: Legal costs and expenses the insured may become liable to pay to another party in making a civil claim against that other party
policy_definitions.free_legal_advice: Basic legal advice over the telephone relating to a possible civil claim with potential to fall under policy cover. No correspondence will be entered into
policy_definitions.insured: The person named in the schedule to this policy
policy_definitions.legal_proceedings: A claim for damages or compensation pursued in a court of law within England, Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland
policy_definitions.maximum_amount: £50,000 in total, including Professional Fees and Defendant's Costs, for one or more claims during a single Period of Cover
policy_definitions.period_of_cover: The period stated in the schedule to this policy
policy_definitions.professional_fees: Legal fees and costs reasonably incurred by the Authorized Representative with insurer's prior authority, including costs by court order or paid with consent. Includes disbursements if services by third party, distinct from representative's services, and prior permission obtained for costs over £500 including VAT
policy_definitions.reasonable_prospect_of_success: Civil claim is deemed by insurer or authorized representative to have more than a 51% chance of being successful in recovering loss
policy_definitions.small_claim: A claim which is or may be allocated to the small claims jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales or equivalent in Scotland and Northern Ireland
policy_definitions.computer_virus: A set of corrupting, harmful or otherwise unauthorized instructions or code including maliciously introduced code that propagates through a computer system or network. Includes trojan horses, worms and time or logic bombs
policy_definitions.electronic_data: Facts, concepts and information converted to a form useable for communications, interpretation or processing by electronic equipment. Includes programmes, software and coded instructions

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: 180-day waiting period for boundary disputes (disputes that occur within first 180 days are excluded)
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Notify insurer as soon as possible after event. Full details must be received within 180 days of the event giving rise to claim
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: If disputed claim not referred to arbitration within 12 months of being turned down, claim is treated as abandoned
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later) for full refund if no claims made/pending

Must take reasonable care to provide accurate and complete information
Failure to provide accurate information may result in policy being invalid or claims not paid
Policy cancellation for fraud/misrepresentation may affect eligibility for insurance with other insurers

common_questions.question: What is covered under this policy?
common_questions.answer: Legal expenses up to £50,000 for contract disputes and property protection claims relating to your 2nd property that is not let out. Includes a 24/7 free legal advice helpline.

common_questions.question: Can I use this policy if I let out my second property?
common_questions.answer: No. The property must not be let for residential or other purposes including holidays. This is a fundamental requirement of the policy.
common_questions.section_reference: 2nd Property definition, page 2; What is not insured, page 4

common_questions.question: How quickly do I need to report a claim?
common_questions.answer: You must notify the insurer as soon as possible, and provide full details within 180 days of the event giving rise to your claim. Delays may reduce or prevent you from receiving assistance.
common_questions.section_reference: Policy Conditions, page 7; Reporting of Claims, page 7

common_questions.question: Can I choose my own solicitor?
common_questions.answer: No, initially the insurer appoints the Authorized Representative. However, you have legal rights to choose your own representative at the point of or during legal proceedings. The insurer may also permit you to instruct another representative if they consider it fair.
common_questions.section_reference: Reporting of Claims, page 7; Policy Conditions, page 7

common_questions.question: What does 'Reasonable Prospect of Success' mean?
common_questions.answer: Your claim must be deemed by the insurer or authorized representative to have more than a 51% chance of being successful in recovering your loss.
common_questions.section_reference: Policy Definitions - Reasonable Prospect of Success, page 3

common_questions.question: Are small claims covered?
common_questions.answer: No. Professional fees and defendant's costs for small claims are excluded. Small claims are those allocated to the small claims jurisdiction of the courts.

common_questions.question: What is the excess on this policy?
common_questions.answer: There is a £250 excess for nuisance or trespass claims under Property Protection (Section 3). This is payable as soon as the claim is accepted. No excess is mentioned for contract disputes.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 3 - Property Protection, What is not insured (j), page 5

common_questions.question: What happens if I disagree with the insurer's assessment that my claim has no reasonable prospect of success?
common_questions.answer: The insurer will instruct an independent Authorized Representative to advise whether your claim has reasonable prospects. If they confirm it doesn't, the insurer will not be liable to pay anything. If they confirm it does, the insurer will appoint them to act on your behalf.

common_questions.question: Can I cancel this policy and get a refund?
common_questions.answer: Yes, within 14 days of purchase or receipt of documents (whichever is later) you can get a full refund if no claims have been made or are pending. After 14 days you can cancel but will not receive a premium refund.

common_questions.question: Does this cover boundary disputes?
common_questions.answer: Boundary disputes at your 2nd property are covered, but only if they don't predate the period of insurance and don't occur within the first 180 days of cover.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 3 - Property Protection, What is not insured (h), page 5

common_questions.question: What is the Free Legal Advice helpline and how do I use it?
common_questions.answer: It provides basic legal advice over the telephone 24/7 for personal legal issues under England, Wales, Scotland & Northern Ireland jurisdiction. Call 0333 4008217 with your policy number and master certificate number F&L2NDP/09/2020. This is NOT notification of a claim - claims must be reported separately.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1 - 24/7 Free Legal Advice Line, page 4

common_questions.question: Are construction or building disputes covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, but only for construction, building, designing, converting or extending your 2nd property, and the amount in dispute must be more than £1,000. Construction work on other properties is excluded.

common_questions.question: What happens if the solicitor refuses to continue acting for me?
common_questions.answer: If the authorized representative refuses to continue acting on your behalf, the insurer will not pay anything further under the policy and their liability ceases. The insurer may appoint another representative if they consider it fair.
common_questions.section_reference: Reporting of Claims (g) and (h), page 7; General Policy Exclusions (o), page 5

common_questions.question: Can I make a claim for disputes with my family?
common_questions.answer: No. Disputes with members of your family are excluded, as are divorce, custody, guardianship, inheritance and related family matters.

common_questions.question: Is terrorism covered?
common_questions.answer: No. Any direct or indirect consequence of terrorism as defined by the Terrorism Act 2000 is excluded.
